remarks: If ` F ` is a real valued function, ` B ` is a limit point of its domain, and the limit of ` F ` at ` B ` exists, then this limit is real.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
limcrecl.1 $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> RR ) $.
limcrecl.2 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ CC ) $.
limcrecl.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( ( limPt ` ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) ) ` A ) ) $.
limcrecl.4 $e |- ( ph -> L e. ( F limCC B ) ) $.
limcrecl $p |- ( ph -> L e. RR ) $.
